abstract: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index rose above 1,400 for the first time in almost four years and is on pace for the best first quarter since 1998.
snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index rose above 1,400 for the first time in almost four years and is on pace for the best first quarter since 1998.
lead_paragraph: Stocks advanced on Thursday, sending the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index above 1,400 for the first time in almost four years, as data showed manufacturing in the New York region unexpectedly increased and jobless claims declined.

headline.main: Shares Continue Surge as S.&P. Breaks 1,400
headline.print_headline: Shares Continue Surge As S.&P. Breaks 1,400
